page.title: 13Ecology in Lower Wood Area
page.content: The area is rich in animal and bird life,providing homes for such species as owls,thrushes,finches,tits and wrens as well as foxes,badgers,hedge- hogs and amphibians.There are many small streams and ponds which seem to be pollution-free and are therefore healthy environments for wildlife. The hedgerows are abundant in wild flowers and native shrubs such as haw- thorn,holly and hazel although owing to modern hedgecutters,sweet briar and honeysuckle are less common than in the past.Cowslips,with which the fields were once 'yellow over',are struggling back and some primroses can be seen.Nature lovers regret the decline of meadow plants such as ragged robin,orchids and quaking grass In the dingles, sheets of bluebells, clumps of yellow iris and marsh mari- golds are now greatly reduced.
